title: Showers expected in Eastern Province & Mullaittivu District
byline: The Department of Meteorology says that a few showers will occur in Eastern Province and in Mullaitivu District today (13).

title: US arms flow to Ukraine again as Kremlin mulls a ceasefire proposal
byline: U.S. arms deliveries to Ukraine resumed Wednesday, officials said, a day after the Trump administration lifted its suspension of military aid for Kyiv in its fight against Russia’s invasion, and officials awaited the Kremlin’s response to a proposed 30-day ceasefire endorsed by Ukraine.

title: Sexual assault of A’pura Hospital doctor: Two including suspect’s sister arrested
byline: The sister of the suspect linked to the sexual assault of a female doctor at the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital, along with another individual, has been arrested, police confirmed.

title: Nationwide GMOA strike ends today, A’pura Hospital strike continues
byline: The token strike launched by the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) across all hospitals in the country in protest of the sexual assault of a female doctor concluded at 8.00 a.m. today (13).

title: 21 hostages killed by insurgents after train attack in Pakistan, all others freed
byline: Insurgents who attacked a passenger train carrying 440 passengers in restive southwestern Pakistan killed 21 hostages before security forces killed all 33 of the assailants, and all other passengers were rescued, officials said Wednesday.

title: Intel appoints chip industry veteran Lip-Bu Tan as CEO
byline: Intel on Wednesday named former board member and chip industry veteran Lip-Bu Tan as its CEO and signaled the struggling but storied chipmaker was unlikely to split up its chip-design and manufacturing operations.

title: Several radiation machines at Apeksha Hospital breakdown disrupting cancer treatment
byline: The Government Radiological Technologists Association states that three out of the five radiation machines used to treat cancer patients at Apeksha Hospital in Maharagama have broken down.

title: Body of youth who died under suspicious circumstances found under flyover
byline: The body of a young man who has died under suspicious circumstances has been found under the flyover near the expressway at the Keeriyagodella Junction on the Angunakolapelessa-Abeysekaragama road.

title: Doctors and staff call off strike at A’pura Hospital
byline: The doctors and the staff at the Anuradhapura Teaching Hospital have called off their strike after discussions with relevant authorities, the Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) said.

title: Election Commission hints at LG Polls date
byline: The Election Commission has announced an extension of key deadlines related to the upcoming local government elections, with the official polling date to be determined after the nomination process.
